Offending code is:

IMarker[] markers = p.findMarkers(BUILDPATH_PROBLEM_MARKER, false, DEPTH_ZERO);
for (int i = 0, l = markers.length; i < l; i++)
>>>>>  if (((Integer) markers[i].getAttribute(IMarker.SEVERITY)).intValue() 
             == IMarker.SEVERITY_ERROR)
	return true;

It could occur only if #findMarkers did answer null markers ?! or if the 
severity attribute wasn't present. In both cases this would indicate a platform 
issue since all build path markers are created with a severity attribute.

Moving to platform/core. Is this a concurrency issue ? Markers being removed 
while some code is running ?

From reviewing the code I can't see any obvious concurrency problems that would
cause null entries in the array or "lost" attributes. Clearly getAttribute can
return null, but I agree from looking at your code that I don't see how such a
classpath marker could exist without a severity.

I'll hang onto the bug and hope we can get a reproducible test case.

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2-b28)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-b28, mixed mode)

Changing the summary.

I've discovered a thread safety problem in MarkerSets.  There is an NPE risk
when adds/removes happen concurrently with finds.  Need to copy the set on modfy
to support concurrent lookup.
*** Bug 45183 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This was fixed last week, but forgot to close the bug.
